medical_history.chief_complaint: Anergic and anhedonic symptoms leading to significant functional impairment.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 33 months before admission following a recommendation for surgical repair of an abdominal aortic aneurysm. Initial symptoms included depressed mood, anhedonia, and fatigue. Over time, symptoms progressed to include anergia, anxiety, insomnia, decreased concentration, and poor appetite, resulting in a weight loss of 6.8 kg. The patient also ceased work, exercise, and social activities. After initial psychiatric intervention and medication adjustments, symptoms worsened, leading to subsequent psychiatric hospital admissions.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Congestive heart failure, hyperlipidemia, nephrolithiasis, gout, carpal tunnel syndrome, and a prior major depressive episode 20 years earlier following coronary-artery bypass grafting.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had a pacemaker, three siblings had depression; father's health history is not known.
medical_history.social_history: Retired, lives with second wife, consumes alcohol in moderation, stopped smoking 20 years ago, and did not use illicit drugs.
